name: ritually
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is done as part of a ritual (= a fixed set of actions and words, especially as part of a religious ceremony): A goat was ritually sacrificed as part of the ceremony. The worshippers ritually cleanse themselves in the river before making their way to the temple.
in a way that is done because it is the normal thing to do: Candidates ritually pledge that they will work night and day, but voters have become cynical of such promises. Articles on the subject ritually claim that globalization is the cause of the problems.
More examplesFewer examplesIf something is kosher it means it is ritually correct under Jewish law.She ritually destroyed all the paintings in her studio in an enormous bonfire.The same old stories are ritually brought out every time we get together.
